properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The Beauty Salon & Spa GITHA was founded by Mrs. Wayan Artini. It is established in Sanur, a tourist village at Bali\'s South-eastern coast. The owner is an expert of this genre and she is convinced, that beauty is something that is given to each and every one of us in different ways, something that people should really care for, because it makes us what we are. To discover the magic of your beauty, come into our salon! Should you prefer to get our services in your house or hotel in Sanur, our staff will be happy to visit you there. We will create your image with excellence, so that your beauty reflects on you even more.

properties.name: Goa Gajah
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali At the facade of the cave is a relief of various menacing creatures and demons carved right into the rock at the cave entrance. The primary figure was once thought to be an elephant, hence the nickname Elephant Cave. The site is mentioned in the Javanese poem Desawarnana written in 1365. An extensive bathing place on the site was not excavated until the 1950s.[2] These appear to have been built to ward off evil spirits.

properties.name: Goa Lawah
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Visit the Bat Cave, Goa Lawah, located on the southeast coast of Bali. Thousands of bats inhabit this natural, open-mouthed cave. Squeaking, twittering, scrambling over each other, flying out and quickly returning to the dark--they never stop moving. Women in ceremonial dress place offerings at the cave entrance and make blessings to the gods residing here. Before entering this sacred site, you must rent a yellow sash at the temple in front of the cave, to tie around your waist.

properties.name: Gunung Kawi
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Location Gunung Kawi is located at Tampaksiring village, right on the cross-road heading to Tirta Empul Temple. The site can be reached through a footpath towards Pakerisan river on which banks Gunung Kawi monuments is located. One can reach the site through the footpath for about 15 minutes walk. History Gunung Kawi is a site of ancient monuments supposed to be built in the eleventh century. Before reaching the site one should go through several stairs and gates and right there across the river one can find two rows of monuments sculptured on the rocky stone wall, considered to be the tomb of King Erlangga\'s younger brother named "Anak Wungsu" (the last child) while the right end of the tenth tomb is considered to be the tomb of the Prime Minister by the archeologists, due to the writing of "rakryan" (minister), while the locals suppose it to be a highpriest\'s tomb.

properties.name: Hai Tide Huts
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Inspired by the traditional Indonesian rice house or \'lumbung\', the Hai Tide Huts\' unique design offers the unique experience of a your own remote tropical island hideaway in comfort together with a variety of watersports (& land based) activities available. Huts come with either king size or twin bedding, air conditioning & ceiling fans. Large glass doors open onto a private balcony. On the lower level is a bale bengong with \'day beds\' - perfect to sit back & enjoy the cool ocean breezes. All Hai Tide Huts feature a private balcony, individually controlled air conditioning and ceiling fan. Shower and bath facilities are shared (there are four large bathrooms completed with double vanities, hot and cold water shower that are shared between the 15 huts)

properties.name: Hard Rock Hotels
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The resort features 418 tribute rooms and suites fit for a rock star. The walls are adorned with images, memorabilia and icons reflecting the revolution that changed the face of music, fashion and the arts, celebrating artistes from the 50\'s to late 90\'s. Rockin\' Tots to Grunge Grand Dads, the hotel is here to rock yer socks off!

properties.name: Hotel Santika Beach Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Embracing an oceanfront parcel of tropical landscape, Hotel Santika Premiere Beach Resort Bali is a restful sanctuary for travellers seeking to escape the everyday pressures of modern living. A total of 171 stylishly appointed guest rooms, suites and private bungalows are scattered across a garden environment that exhibits a superb collection of native trees and fragrant flora. Here guests will experience a dedicated level of hospitality that is distinct only to Bali and complemented by the quality services and amenities that have made the Santika group an icon across the Indonesian archipelago.

properties.name: Hotel Uyah
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Мы осуществили и поддерживаем экологическую систему управления, чтобы уменьшить потребление природных ресурсов и предотвратить загрязнение ненужным разделением, энергией и водой - экономия установок и программ. Мы пытаемся сообщить наши экологические цели к местному сообществу и нашего гостя s, чтобы быть в гармонии с этой красивой окружающей средой.

properties.name: Island Horse Riding
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Our Stables are located on the coast, at the Seaside village of Yeh Gangga, just west of most photographed and one of Bali\'s most sacred places, Tanah Lot. The scenery is beautiful in this peaceful village, where rice farming, fishing and sea salt harvesting are the main activities. Gently sloping rice terraces fringe a sparkling black mineral shore, trail riding west, we pause at a waterfall, sea-salt harvesting area, a temple set on the cliffs, a bat cave and a natural rock headland which juts out of the crystal Blue Ocean, but best of all, an opportunity to swim with the horses An idyllic setting, invigorating sea air, crystal clear ocean, spectacular coastline, rural panorama and the local people, completes our trip of natural beauty and Balinese hospitality. A glimpse into village life, where culture and tradition entwine, along the small paths, past the traditional family housing compounds, home industries and the friendly smiling faces Bali is Unique. An optional lunch is available in the spectacular Boutique Resort of Waka Gangga, superb food in a unique setting.

properties.name: Jagatnatha Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Jagatnatha Temple (Pura Agung Jagatnatha) as a holy place is located on Mayor Wisnu Street, North - East of Puputan Badung Park. It is strategically located for being close to the other places of interest within the City Tour package and visitors will be very much interested in its traditional architecture. This temple is the focus of religious activities held by the locals during Hindu holidays, especially every full moon night. It can easily be reached by public transport from three main terminals like: Ubung, Tegal and Kreneng.

properties.name: Jamahal Spa
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Following the ancient sanskrit legend about the gods quest to find the elixir of immortality and eternal youth. Jamahal Spa, originating in bali, has embraced this legend. The "Jamahal SPA philosophy" incorporates balinese treatments, keeping roots in traditional and classic techniques, stemming from europe and asia as jamahal massage, borehs, traditional balinese- and javanese- massage, shiatsu, hot stone and ayurveda treatments will rebalance and rejuvenate your mind body and spirit. Jl. Uluwatu, Gang Batu Putih 1, Jimbaran 80361 Bali - Indonesia Telp : (0062 361) 704 394 Fax. No: (0062 361) 704 597

properties.name: Jatiluwih
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Jatiluwih as a natural tourist attraction, had actually been known since the Dutch colonization in Bali (1910-1942), because the Dutch troop once built a military base camp on the western part of the village and up to this moment the locals call it as "Tangsi Belanda" (The Dutch Barrack). The Provincial Government of Bali has announced Jatiluwih as one of tourism villages as to increase the number of tourist arrival to this island because of its great potency as previously mentioned.

properties.name: Jemeluk Beach
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  The history about Jemeluk is almost unknown since there is no manuscript ever found. However, some elderly people of Jemeluk give information that the name "Jemeluk" had been known far before the kingdom of Karangasem existed and that the area used to belong to Culik sub - district ("Perbekel"). It is told that the word "Jemeluk" derived from the word "menyeluk" (receded), so "Jemeluk" means "the receded sea". This place of interest is more and more known among those who are fond of diving, snorkeling and other activities. When the asphalted road from Amed to Seraya is finished, this\' beach is even more popular since it is easier to reach. The locals earn their living on fishing and raising cattle due to the land texture, the small frequency of rainfall so that the land is rather dry and barren, however the beauty of the combination between mountain and vast sea view with tough cliff framing the area has been a spectacular attraction to the visitors.

properties.name: Jro Kuta Palace
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  Instead of Satria and Pemecutan Palace, Jro Kuta Palace is also included into the City-tour package. It is located very closely to the heart of Denpasar city about 300m from Pasar Badung and Pasar Kumbasari, the traditional markets. The palace\'s main attraction is its 9 specific buildings called: "Ancak Saji", "Semanggen", "Rangki", Pewaregan", "Saren Raja", "Saren Kangin", "Paseban", "Pemerajan Agung", the holy place and "Pekandelan" with their respective functions. The other building is the palace\'s fortress against the enemy\'s attack. Jro Kuta Palace is located on Jalan Kumbakarna or about 100m from Maospahit Temple previously mentioned.

properties.name: Kafe Warisan
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali When partners Said Alem and Nicolas “Doudou” Tourneville opened Kafe Warisan in February 1997 they dreamed of offering visitors to, and residents of, Bali the highest standard of dining service and incomparable French Mediterranean cuisine overlooking the rice fields of one of South East Asia’s most favourite islands. And they succeeded. Today Kafe Warisan Restaurant & Bar is world renowned.

properties.name: Kama Sutra Bali Restaurant, Club and Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Kama Sutra is a feast of the sense, scent, taste, sight and sound. A restaurant, club and lounge with Indian and a bit of Mediterranian architecture on the outer appearance. Enter the restaurant and you will the theme continued. With pillars, striking high ceiling ballroom.

properties.name: Karma Kandara
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Set to become one of Asia’s iconic destinations, Karma Kandara engenders a sense of back to nature spiritualism combined with cutting edge architecture and facilities. Such is its magnetic appeal that no visitor arrives without a gasping appreciation of the stunning scenery and laid-back ambience, nor leaves without an overpowering desire to return.

properties.name: Kayu Alam
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali We provide the Balinese Product to export from Bali Indonesia. Where Bali was renown as a unique and exquisite art and culture, interesting people to collect the art from Bali itself. You don\'t have to come to Bali if you like to find any art handicraft product, you could make your own order with your own design to us, we will proceed it and go thorough with our artisans will try our best. We made-to-order as well as our services for your convenience using our our website and services.

properties.name: Kecak Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Kecak Bali Traditional Balinese and Steamboat was created to fulfill the visitors of our magic island of Bali their wishes to sample the many variety of traditional dish available served as a Balinese Rijsttafel, as well as some of the famous Asian HOT POT, which is known as STEAMBOAT. Guest will discover not only the Balinese selection but also a small variety of the most request western meals such as spaghetti, snitzel, green salad and many more for their dining choices.

properties.name: Komaneka Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Komaneka Fine Art Gallery features unique work by artists with new and exciting visions that reflect the lifestyles of contemporary connoisseurs.

properties.name: Kori Restaurant and Bar
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Nestled into one of the busiest streets of Kuta, Bali\'s famous tourist hub is perhaps the last place you would expect to find a restaurant that has, in its short life, gained a solid reputation for its highly successful blend of fine food, excellent bar, friendly staff and supremely laid back tempo.Those who seek the hills to escape the relentless pace of this bustling town should look no further than the solid stone gateway of KORI, which offers all that pass a cool sanctuary to escape to. Water and gardens are a large feature of the open and airy restaurant, which has a number of quiet hideaways in the form of Balinese bales. These secluded dining platforms with traditional alang-alang roofs are full of large plump cushions and make perfect dining areas.The menu features a mixture of Western and Balinese dishes served in a simple and honest style with an emphasis on flavour. Fresh, local produce is mostly used except where local substitute is substandard or is unavailable, as in beef, dairy, oils and delicatessen items. The menu also includes a special homestyle cooking section for homesick expatriates.

properties.name: KuDeTa
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Since its opening in 2000 KU DE TA has risen from the making of a beachside retreat evolving into a sacred landscape, complimented by the Indian Ocean and a backdrop of color changing in the sky. Like all things great, the evolution of KU DE TA began as a vision and has evolved into a story. It is a story of contemporary and traditional harmony, a natural evolution representing eastern and western philosophy. The beauty is found in its simplicity. It is an architectural sanctuary coinciding peacefully with the environment. It is a world where towering trees and gentle pools of running water offer a gesture of welcome. Sandstone walls graced with intricate carvings and detailed mirror work narrate a story of times passed. A pathway of natural rock and symmetrical stone squares transcends into a contemporary museum with painting and sculptures adorning the walls. Elements reflect an appreciation for the natural world. An energy-filled dining area represents a fusion of worlds featuring dark woods, seductive colors and music representing styles and sounds from around the globe. Adjoining communal areas outline the courtyard, creating an open-sided pavilion reflective of a time where people gathered to respect the kings, honor the gods and engage in merrymaking celebration. Daily offerings are placed in the temple s as presents to the gods and strangers unite under a sunset indulging in the fine pleasure of life. Jalan Laksmana No. 9 Seminyak Bali 80361 p] +62 361 736969 f] +62 361 736767 e] info@kudeta.net

properties.name: Kubu Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Enjoy peace and serenity in the sleepy seaside village of candi dasa. From here one has easy access to East Bali\'s spectacular unspoiled beauty. A short distance from the hotel one encounters dramatic views of Mt Agung, Bali\'s sacred mountain; lush green rice terraces clinging to steep and sweeping valleys; traditional villages following age-old customs; colourful rituals and ceremonies; and crystal-clear seas rich in coral and marine life. Here there is a timeless quality as ancient cultures and traditions remain unchanged - an essential element of daily life.

properties.name: Kudos Bar and Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali This is definitely a bar that’s going to set the pace for others to follow –but its going to be hard for any bar to match up to this!. The attention to detail is mind-blowing. The bathrooms designs are the result of a special commission given to one of Chinas most talented design houses and cost a small fortune but its attention to things like that that will surely attract the well heeled visitor to bali.

properties.name: Kunis Japanese Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Unusual feature of Kuni\'s Bali is the Kushi Yaki (grilled foods on skewers) section of the kitchen, which stands tantalizingly behind glass at the entrance to the restaurant. Vegetables, fish, chicken and beef are prepared as some of the possible kushi-yaki combination, which blend well with the tropical dining atmosphere of Bali, as an accompanient to other dishes or as a meal in itself. For the noodle lover there is a choice of buckwheat and plain noodle dishes, and vegetarian are well catered for, as a substantial selection of tasty vegetaria dishes are offered from all section of the menu.

properties.name: Kupu kupu Barong
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Kupu Kupu Barong Beach Resort is a secret sanctuary on the magical island of Bali. Our stunning boutique hotel is set within a shady tropical garden that gently spills on to a secluded private beach of soft white sand. Our concept was to create a hidden world in keeping with tradition and in tune with nature, simple yet luxurious, exotic and romantic. We are committed to serving the needs of the sophisticated traveller by blending contemporary style with exceptional hospitality. Offering much more than just the amenities of a hotel, we are proud to present our guests with a rare and blissful lifestyle experience of uncompromising quality and unsurpassed personal service. Kedewatan PO BOX 7 80571UBUD, Bali Indonesia ph:+62 361 975 478 fax: +62 361 975 079 www.kupubarongubud.com

properties.name: Lamak Restaurant & Bar
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The two story restaurant features a number of casual corners to enjoy a drink or a meal, and Ubud\'s only air-conditioned lounge. A walk-in wine room, creative cocktails and some very funky touches make this a memorable restaurant at any time of the day or night. Dramatic steel sculpture contributes riveting accents to the atmosphere against striking burgundy-colored walls. The decor is anchored with bold, punched-out steel panels mounted in relief and freestanding, embellished with Lamak\'s unique logo. Local stone statuary is complimented by unique resin sculpture in whimsical shapes, such as twin hounds illuminated.

properties.name: Lempuyang Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Pura Lempuyang (Lempuyang temple) is located on Lempuyang Mountain, Karangasem Regency, east Bali. The Balinese Hindu’s named it Sad Khayangan Agung Lempuyang Luhur, which is the place for Hyang Iswara and Hyang Agni Jaya. Puja Wali/ piodalan (sacred day) is held every six months, exactly on Umanis Galungan, Kamis (Thursday) wuku Dungulan, or the day after the Galungan ceremony. To go to Lempuyang temple from Denpasar, it is about 80 km, a 2 hour journey to the east. Along the way, you will see beautiful scenery, rice field panoramas and rivers. Lempuyang Temple contains a lot of mysteries from a long time ago, when Sang Hyang Pasupati recommended Hyang Gni Jaya together with Hyang Putra Jaya and Dewi Danuh to save Bali from disaster. Later, according to the villagers, as well as for praying, there are also people who come to Lempuyang Temple for other purposes, such as to recover from illnesses, avoid evil, and there are even politicians or officials who pray that their authority will be forever or to try to obtain a certain position. Usually they come in the middle of night, in order to avoid the public.

properties.name: Leolle Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Having Started in the year 2000 as a by family business, Leolle as a company is established in 2002 targets worldwide market. For our internal market, Bali Island - Indonesia, we sell our exclusive products under our brand for the aromatic incense and decorative items provided in leading home decorative stores. Nowadays, we accentuate the company with extended possibilities in developing new design by our designers. Léollé\'s concept comes from the realization that the rich tradition of Indonesian craftsmanship could be used in a modern way to create simple yet contemporary products with an Asian touch…

properties.name: Lovina Beach,
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali There are no definite evidences or sources of information about the origin of the name "Loving" however, based on the information given by the sons of the late Anak Agung Panji Tisna, the descendant of the King of Buleleng who was also a well known man-of-letters, the name "Lovina" was given by the late upon a property under his name located at Kaliasem village on which he built a bungalow as resting place. It was said that the name Lovina taken from a small hotel in India named : "Lafeina" where he spent his night and wrote a book titled "Ni Ketut Widhi"., which was then translated into several foreign languages. To remember the small hotel in India, he then gave his property a name "Lovina". However there is a different version telling that the name "Lovina" was given, because there were two "santen" trees planted by his son which then grew embracing each other and that "Lovina" in Latin means "love each other". The name "Lovina" was then translated by Mr. I Ketut Ginantra, the regent of Buleleng (1988-1993) as an acronym of "Love" and "Ina" means "Love Indonesia".

properties.name: Lovina Dive
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali LOVINA DIVE Bali is the specialist in Bali for all aspects of scuba diving and caters for experienced divers, novice divers and even people that have never dived before. We have been in operation since 1994 and a great combination of western standard and local knowledge ensures our customers are always happy! Our team of professionals, are chosen for their wealth of experience and knowledge in the diving industry and their position and respect for preserving and maintaining Bali\'s many reefs. Diving BaliOur goal is to provide excellent fun, and adventurous yet safe diving for all our clients. We at Lovina Dive Bali believe that quality, safety and service are the hallmark of a successful business, and are committed to providing first class service. You will find no one else can offer the same value and service in recreational scuba diving as LOVINA DIVE Bali.

properties.name: M Bar Go
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Opened in 2004, M BAR GO is Bali’s Premier Nightclub that caters to everyone no matter what your Taste or Style may be. With 2 floors pumpin’ out different music genres, it’s almost impossible not to move yo’ Body and party the night away true \'Bali Party Hearty\' style ! ! If you don’t feel like hitting da dancefloor, there’s a V. I. P. Lounge from which you can sit back, sip on a Cocktail and check out the scene . . .

properties.name: Maccaroni
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Maccaroni was established in 1996 and is a destination point in the heart of Kuta. Architecturally Maccaroni is an exciting and vibrant restaurant featuring modern Italian cuisine at an reasonable price. The design behind Maccaroni is best described as an urban environment featuring the use of traditional materials. The contrasting format provides the guest with focal points of interest as well as being a fully functional space. Maccaroni has proved to be an ongoing project for Italian architect Giovanni D\'Ambroisio with yearly visits to Bali from Rome where he is constantly bringing in refreshing new concepts and ideas to enhance our overall appeal. Maccaroni is an aesthetically stunning venue which provides the utmost in fantastic food, delicious drinks and exciting entertainment.

properties.name: Made's Warung
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Made\'s warung was established in 1969 and has become a social eating and meeting venue for locals, expats and tourist alike. It has grown from a traditionalroadside warung into a cosmopolitan restaurant serving the widest variety of food in Bali. Jalan Raya Seminyak - Bali - 80361 phone +62 361 753039 | fax +62 361 761959

properties.name: Mas Village
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali In the era of Bedahulu Kingdom of 13th Century the King was named: Sri Tapolung or. Sri Gajah Waktra with his greatest name: "Sri Aji Astasura Ratna Bumi Banten". He was famous for his pride and arrogance for having magic power, supported by his assistants among others, Ki Pasung Grigis, Gudug Basur etc. Knowing that Bedahulu Kingdom was in such a condition, the King of Majapahit i.e.: Sri Kala Gemet or Sri Jaya Negara, son of Sri Arsa Wijaya or King Kerta Rajasa Jaya Wardana (Majapahit\'s the first King) sent his assistant, Gajah Mada to Bali and attacked the island. He was accompanied by his war commander, Arya Damar and several assistants. In this great war, the King of Bedahulu was defeated. Some of the Aryas coming from Majapahit stayed in Bali in order to return the situation in Bali into normal, were: Mas Wilis/Tan Kober, Mas Sempur/Tan Kaur, Mas Mega/ Tan Mundur. After staying in Bali for few decades, the Kingdom of Majapahit collapsed after having undergone some problems caused by its internal issues and Moslem influence. A high priest called Pedanda Sakti Bawu Rauh or also called Danghyang Nirartha came to Bali because he couldn\'t stand to stay in Majapahit anymore. After a long journey and wide experience, he arrived at Mas village under the invitation of Mas Willis. During his stay at this village, he tought Mas Willis religion, social, cultural arts etc. After learning all the lessons and knowledges Mas Willis was purificated by this priest and given a new name: Prince of Manik Mas, in order to respect his merit. Afterwards, the prince of Manik Mas built a house with its equipments for the priest. In order to commemorate this event, the priest planted a "tangi stick" (Tangi tree) as a proof and this tree can be seen there up to now, planted in the inner courtyard of Taman Pulemas Temple. Since that time of the priest, the village has been called Mas village. Besides that, the prince gave his daughter, named Ayu Kayuan (Mas Gumitir) to the priest. From his mariage with Mas Gumitir, Brahmana Mas was born who has lived in this village ever since.

properties.name: Matahari Cottage Bed & Breakfast
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Unlike other Indonesians, Balinese people mainly believe in Hindu Dharma. Touring the island, you will encounter the characteristic brilliant smiles, which signal the attitude of the Balinese people. Ubud, a colony of art and culture, is one of the most traditional areas in Bali. The people of Ubud dress in their native sarongs and maintain traditional religious ceremonies. Walking on the streets of Ubud, you might have the illusion of wandering through an ancient city. Matahari Cottage Bed & Breakfast is situated on a secluded ravine, only a five to seven minute walk from Ubud Palace. Numerous birds and butterflies weave through the surrounding lush green jungle and garden of colorful, exotic flowers. Flocks of white herons fly in a V formation as the glowing Balinese sun sets. The birds are on their way to their native habitat, the village of Bedulu, located a fifteen-minute drive from Ubud. Bedulu is a popular spot for tourists.

properties.name: Medewi Beach
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Medewi Beach like the other beaches in Bali always has special attraction. The name Medewi is taken from the village where the beach is located. It is assumpted that Medewi known as a settlement in 1912 when a group of people from Mendoyo Dauh Tukad village (west of Medewi) came as the first inhabitant. Before clearing away the location which was a forest full with thorny plants called "ketket", the group of people then called the area Medewi (derived from "Meduwi" means thorny) forest. After the forest was cleared away and then become a settlement, the village then also named: Medewi as it is known nowadays.

properties.name: Meduwe Karang Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Meduwe Karang Temple is presumed to be built for requesting fertility, especially for dry and barren land as well as for fruit and vegetable plantations. Similar to the temples built by "Subak" group (traditional farming), cultivating wet land or rice fields, this temple is adhered by farmers cultivating dry and barren land like : coconut, maize, tobacco, beans, coffee, cotton, lontar palm and particular species of fruit. Accordingly, the ceremony held at the temple is to request the God\'s blessing for all products of dry-field ("tegalan").

properties.name: Mengwi Mandala Wisata
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Mengwi Mandala Wisata in one of places of interest in Bali built by the Government in 1974 functioned as tourist information on the Balinese art and culture. This complex is also completed with a museum called "Manusa Yadnya Museum" in which visitors can see display of the Balinese ritual process called "Manusa Yadnya" starting with blessing ceremony given to six-months old fetus inside the mother\'s womb, newly born baby, 42 days old baby, 3 months old, 6 months old, coming of age teens, followed with tooth-filing ceremony, wedding, cremation and "Memukur" (the following ritual after cremation) completed with the cremation tower and the coffin called "Lembu").

properties.name: Monkey Forest‎
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali At the end of Monkey Forest Road in Ubud, Bali there\'s an open air monkey santuary. No gates. No cages. They\'re free to leave at any point. These little monkeys can get nasty though if you don\'t purchase and feed them some bananas. Unfortunately, our room key was a dried round piece of fruit and I got into a \'I\'ll trade you\' game of banana for the key. We both got what we wanted.

properties.name: Mother Besakih Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The Mother Temple of Besakih, or Pura Besakih, in the village of Besakih on the slopes of Mount Agung in eastern Bali, is the most important temple of Agama Hindu Dharma in Bali, Indonesia and one of a series of Balinese temples. It had been nominated as a World Heritage Site as early as 1995, but remains unvested. A series of eruptions of Mount Agung in 1963, which killed approximately 1,700 people also threatened Puru Besakih. The lava flows missed the temple complex by mere yards. The saving of the temple is regarded by the Balinese people as miraculous, and a signal from the gods that they wished to demonstrate their power but not destroy the monument the Balinese faithful had erected.

properties.name: Mount Agung (Gunung Agung)
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Mount Agung or Gunung Agung is a mountain in Bali. This stratovolcano is the highest point on the island. It dominates the surrounding area influencing the climate. The clouds come from the west and Agung takes their water so that the west is lush and green and the east dry and barren. The Balinese believe that Mount Agung is a replica of Mount Meru, the central axis of the universe. One legend hold that the mountain is a fragment of Meru brought to Bali by the first Hindus. The most important temple on Bali, Pura Besakih, is located high on the slopes of Gunung Agung.[2] Gunung Agung last erupted in 1963-64 and is still active, with a large and very deep crater which occasionally belches smoke and ash. From a distance, the mountain appears to be perfectly conical, despite the existence of the large crater. From the peak of the mountain, it is possible to see the peak of Mount Rinjani on the island of Lombok, although both mountains are frequently covered in clouds.

properties.name: Mount Batur (Gunung Batur)
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Mount Batur (Gunung Batur) is an active volcano located at the center of two concentric calderas north west of Mount Agung, Bali, Indonesia. The south east side of the larger 10×13 km caldera contains a caldera lake. The inner 7.5-kilometer-wide caldera, which was formed during emplacement of the Bali (or Ubud) ignimbrite, has been dated at about 23,670 and 28,500 years ago [1] The SE wall of the inner caldera lies beneath Lake Batur; Batur cone has been constructed within the inner caldera to a height above the outer caldera rim. The Batur stratovolcano has produced vents over much of the inner caldera, but a NE-SW fissure system has localized the Batur I, II, and III craters along the summit ridge. Historical eruptions have been characterized by mild-to-moderate explosive activity sometimes accompanied by lava emission. Basaltic lava flows from both summit and flank vents have reached the caldera floor and the shores of Lake Batur in historical time. The caldera contains an active, 700-metre-tall stratovolcano rising above the surface of Lake Batur. The first historically documented eruption of Batur was in 1804, and it has been frequently active since then. The caldera is populated and includes the two main villages of Kedisan and Toya Bungkah. The locals largely rely on agriculture for income but tourism has become increasingly popular due to the relatively straightforward trek to the summit of the central crater. [2] The lake, Danau Batur, is the largest crater lake on the island of Bali and is a good source of fish.

properties.name: Murano SPA
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  No matter HOW you choose to keep yourself healthy, wealthy and wise, you’ll find the secret right here at Murano SPA. Our most important service is to provide you with a very soothing and relaxing place to rejuvenate your mind, body, and soul. In order to provide you with a tranquil environment, we are located in a quiet, peaceful residential area of Seminyak, away from the crowed, noisy areas of Kuta. Nowhere else in Bali will you feel as relaxed or pampered as you will at Murano SPA. Our bit of “Heaven” allows you to relax, step back from your hectic world and appreciate all the good things you have in your life. Murano SPA is a place where your spirit and well-being are our number one priority. Jl. Dewi Saraswati (kunti II), Seminyak Bali - Indonesia Tel : +62 361 738 140 and +62 361 738 139 or +62 361 806 0736 Email : sales@muranospa.com

properties.name: Museum Bali Le Mayeur
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Sanur beach is the most beautiful and attractive recreation for tourists. In the history of " Puputan Badung"( Badung War ) on 18 Nopember 1906, it was the anchorage harbor of the Dutch troops to Sanur beach was proclaimed by a foreign painter, A.T. Le Mayeur. He came to Bali in 1937 because of the beauty of Sanur Beach; he then decided to live permanently on this beach by building a place to paint. Le Mayeur married his model girl, named Ni Polok. She was also a dancer who had been famous at that time. Le Mayeur gallery is full of paintings and interesting books which are kept in a building with Balinese architecture. It was too difficult to get a canvas to paint at that time, so he used traditional cloth made of woven jute to paint. Le Mayeur passed away in 1959 in Belgium and his gallery was then given to the Indonesian Government as Le Mayeur museum.

properties.name: Museum Rudana
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The Rudana Museum was established in 1995, with the main aim of providing an outstanding collection of paintings for the public to study and enjoy. Its presence must also be considered as complementing the existing total of fine art museums, which are much needed in order to improve the community\'s level in the appreciation of the arts. Collections of artwork and the social history of the nation, which the future younger generations can inherit, are preserved in this Museum. The invaluable collections are intrinsically a historical inheritance, which becomes a source of information and educational media. These are all most important for the development and transformation of culture and civilization from one generation to the next. This museum is also intended for artists and people of interest in this area to gather. Here they can exchange experiences and ideas on their respective fields of interest. The Collection was established through the purchase by Nyoman Rudana and Ni Wayan Olastini, who have exhibited tremendous dedication in their twenty-one years of work promoting Indonesian, especially Balinese, arts and artists.The three floors of the Museum represent Balinese architectural philosophical concept of the Tri Angga, namely, the three parts of the human body: head, trunk, and legs. This concept, in the development of plastic art, represents the golden link of artists of the past and the present. The third floor of the Museum houses works of Balinese fine arts from classical to the Ubud and Batuan styles. Among the works in this collection are such outstanding names as I Gusti Nyoman Lempad and Ida Bagus Made.On the second and first floors, works of modern Indonesian fine arts are displayed, covering such widely-known names as: Affandi, Gunarsa, Wianta, and also the works of young and talented artists, such as Boyke Aditya, Nyoman Erawan, and Made Budhiana. The Museum also has a great collection from renowned expatriates such as Antonio Blanco who have made Bali their physical and artistic home.

properties.name: Musro Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali For years, Musro Bali has been popular place in Bali, located in the heart of Kuta, open 7 days a week featuring varieties of entertainment from Cabaret, Line Up, DJ\'s, Live band, Disco and many special theme parties. We also provide many KTV for you to relax and sing along with charming hostesses in private room and dont forget about the capacious venue for private parties. Musro bali is dedicated to serve guest the best possible entertainment with a friendly, pleasant, relaxing surronding and warm ambience.

properties.name: Nikko Bali Resort & Spa
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Bali Hotels: A 5-star diamond luxury resort hotel uniquely and dramatically perched above a 40-metre cliff face overlooking the stunning azure Indian Ocean. Nikko Bali Resort & Spa embraces the mystique of Bali, with its bewildering natural charm, beauty and culture. The friendliness and hospitality of its people, help provide an exotic and intriguing tropical holiday destination for you.

properties.name: Nuri Bayu Bali Furniture
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali This will require a dedicated individual or couple, as Bali is a hot, even very hot, tropical island with slow moving roads. 2 nights per hotel is just enough time to get a feel for each area, take in a show / dance performance, and get the laundry done! Keeping fit, hydrated and away from excesses will not be easy. Nor will taking 44 days off! But for the lucky person(s), with a keen eye for a bargain, quality and culture, this will be a challenge too hard to resist!

properties.name: Nusa Dua Bali Collection‎
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali This resort is one of tourist resorts located in Badung regency known for being a pilot project in tourist development to be proud of by Bali or Indonesia in general. This resort started to develop in 1974 and the Government trusted the management to Bali Tourism Development Corporation (BTDC). Up to this time, 14 star-hotels have been built in this area. Its beach is also best for water sport and other recreational activities.

properties.name: Nusa Dua Beach
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Nusa Dua it is located in the east of peninsula Bukit-Badung. Sea plait Tanjung Benoa is directed to the north. Remarkable beaches of white sand are perfectly equipped. Tourists receive all complex of services of a class lux. Nusa Dua has been conceived as a resort, allowing to take cover from an intense city life. The resort is isolated enough to provide silence and calmness though there is all in several minutes of driving from international airport Ngurah Rai.

properties.name: Nusa Dua Beach Hotel & Spa‎
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Located minutes away from the Ngurah Rai International Airport on the sun-drenched shores of beautiful Nusa Dua, Nusa Dua Beach Hotel & Spa\'s 23 acres of sculpted gardens provide an oasis of space and tranquility in the heart of exotic Bali. The 381 rooms and suites resort invites you to immerse yourself in the pageantry of one of the world\'s most vibrant cultures.A palace of refined luxury and privileged hospitality, this 5-star diamond property has welcomed Kings and Queens, Presidents and Prime Ministers since its grand opening for guests who expect the extraordinary to be an imperative, an unforgettable holiday experience awaits.

properties.name: Nusa Lembongan Resort
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Nusa Lembongan, a small island between Bali and Nusa Penida in the Badung Strait, is the perfect location for a holiday hideaway, with few visitors and pristine unspoilt beaches. Overlooking Sanghiang Bay with its clear sapphire-blue waters, the Nusa Lembongan Resort offers a panoramic view of eastern Bali and the majestic silhouette of Mount Agung. Nusa Lembongan Resort provides our guests with private transfers on the luxurious 87 foot sailing catamaran Sail Sensation. Enjoy a 60-90 minute motorized sail across the Badung Strait departing Benoa Harbour at 9am & Lembongan Island at 4pm. During the trip light snacks and drinks are provided.

properties.name: Ombak Bagus
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  Located in the village of Canggu, Ombak Bagus Homestay is an ideal place for exploring the nearby surfspots of Tugu, Canggu, Brawa and Pererenan. Situated in a rural and quiet setting it offers a taste of everyday Balinese village life. You can reach several great surfspots within a 10 minutes drive. If you want to go shopping or clubbing, the busy tourist areas of Kuta and Legian are only a 20-30 minutes drive away. Also one of Bali\'s most photographed sites, the temple of Tanah Lot is close by, here you can enjoy a beautiful sunset. So if you are looking for a place from which to explore the surfspots of Bali\'s westcoast, or just to spend some quiet, relaxing time, come stay at Ombak Bagus Homestay!

properties.name: Padangbai
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Padang Bai is a natural bay safely sheltered by cluster of hills and has since long been functioned as sea port. During the time of the Dutch colonization and influenced by the using of the language, the name Teluk Padang gradually became Padang Bai (Padang Bay). On the hill of the eastern part of Padang Bai beach there are two temples known as Dang Kahyangan temple (with the entire Balinese as its aherents). One on the North is called Silayukti Temple built by Mpu Kuturan (one of Hindu holymen coming from Java) around XI century during His holy visit to Bali. Mpu Kuturan is a high priest who has great favor in Hindu teaching in Bali. His teaching is still obeyed and applied up to this present time by the Hindu Balinese and the temple\'s anniversary ceremony according to Balinese calendar is always celebrated by its followers coming from all over the island, with rituals and prayers. On the Southern part of Silayukti Temple is Tanjung Sari Temple built by Mpu Baradah, the youngest brother of Mpu Kuturan. On the western part of Padang Bai harbour there is also another temple called Penataran Agung Temple built by another Hindu Holyman from Java named Danghyang Nirartha or Danghyang Dwijendra around XVI century. Danghyang Nirartha or often called "Pedanda Sakti Wawu Rawuh" (The just arrived Mighty Highpriest), is one of Mpu Kuturan descendants. So, instead of going to Padang Bai just for fun or recreation, people especially Balinese or Hindu followers will also come for religious purpose to those temples.

properties.name: Padilla
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Our company, Padilla, has been in sportswear manufacturing for well over 14 years. From small but auspicious start, we have grown to become one of the most diverse and flexible sportswear suppliers in Indonesia today. We are fully aware of the fact that we must keep our product quality at a high standard and will continue to do so by investing in better technology, better manufacturing techniques, and improved production efficiency.

properties.name: Pantai Kuta
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Three hundreds years ago, a Chinese temple was built by the river of "Tukad Mati" which was used to be sailed over by traditional rowing boats or schooners up to the village of Kuta, so since then Kuta had become a commercial port. A Danish sailor/merchant named Mr. Mads Lange built his store by the river in 19 th century. While living in Bali, he often acted as messenger between the Kings of Bali and the Dutch colonialist. Mads Lange died because of uncertain cause of death and he was buried next to the Chinese temple by the river of "Tukad Mati". Nowadays one can find Mads Lange\'s grave right by the bypass road to Nusa Dua. Kuta, once, was a quiet fishermen\'s village which was then developing into a small International town completed with various public facilities while its crescent-moon shaped beach is known all over the world with rows of luxurious hotels adorning it.

properties.name: Pantarei Restaurant Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Inspired by these words, some Greek expatriates with a flair for cooking delicious dishes, ventured to create their very own Greek restaurant and named it Panta rei. In the Greek language, Panta rei means everything flows. In their desire to replicate elegantly modern greek architecture and to further realize their inspiration, these expatriates consigned famous architect Giovanni D’ Ambrosio to design the beautiful building as it stands today.

properties.name: Panti Timbrah Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali As previously mentioned, Panti Timbrah Temple at Paksebali village, is known for interesting event called "Perang Jempana" or "Dewa Sraman" on every Kuningan Holiday. The power - match of four colored "Jempana" (effigy): red, white, yellow and black against checker - colored Jempana symbolizes the inner process of every human being in the form of conflicts towards a final decision: perfectness. The colors of Jempana symbolize points of the compass which are similar to the colours of fluid inside human body. The tradition of "Perang Jempana" originally carried out at Gumang Temple, Karangasem regency brought to Klungkung by the temple -followers when a princess of Karangasem got married to a noble prince, Dewa Agung Putra from Satria Kanginan village.

properties.name: Paradise Villa Nusa Dua
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  Paradise Villa Rental is a dedicated villa rental division of Paradise Property Bali. We pride ourselves on providing you with the most memorable experiences possible every time you come to Bali. From family holidays or weddings to corporate incentive trips and adventure escapes we have it all. Our website features villas that we have personally inspected and consider to be of a high enough standard for us to offer to you. If your dream vacation villa is not featured, then let us know what you would like and we will do our best to find it for you. Your feedback is greatly appreciated.

properties.name: Paras Stone Carving
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Paras Stone Carving is a Balinese stone carving company situated at Silakarang, Singapadu Kaler, Sukawati, Gianyar, Bali, not very far from the township of Ubud which is considered the arts and culture center of the island. Bali is famous for it\'s artisans in many crafts and stone carving is one of those. Paras Stone Carving is an excellent example of the talented stone carvers that practise their art in Bali. Paras Stone Carving was established in September 2004, originally starting with 3 stone carvers to the current number of 12 stone carvers. The carving stone we use mainly is sandstone both grey and white, which comes from central Java.

properties.name: Pasar Badung (Badung Market)
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali It is the biggest traditional market in Bali located on Jalan Gajah Mada at the heart of Denpasar. Jalan Gajah Mada (Gajah Mada Street) is known as the oldest shopping-centre in Denpasar. In Pasar Badung, visitor can enjoy buyers and sellers, involve themselves in business with traditional way of transaction. The market is full of activities along the day while at night; the night market starts with reasonable prices.

properties.name: Pasar Sanglah (Sanglah Market)
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali It is located on jalan Waturenggong or about 2,5 km from the city-centre. The market like the other traditional markets is a business-centre for daily needs, garments and other products mainly for those living at the Southern side of Denpasar. It can easily be reached from any direction and very close to Sanglah General Hospital, some malls and Udayana,University. It opens along the day.

properties.name: Pegulingan Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The temple complex was found in 1983 by the support of local people. Supervision and safety digging done by the local government had resulted in finding the remains of a big Shrine (Stupa) having rectangular base. Other important discovery is a number of hard soil stuffs containing Budhist praying equipments.

properties.name: Peliatan
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Peliatan village has a sufficient potency in cultural art because it is the centre of artists in Bali. In this village various kinds of arts are developed such as statue carving, wood carving and painting. In this village, there are also well-known artists, living, who have got national and international reputation such as: A.A. Cede Mandra, I Wy. Gandra, I Wy. Gerindem, and I Made Lebah, all of whom are under the artist group of Gunung Sari Orchestra. They have attracted a lot of visitors to come and visit this village. Many of the tourists sometimes want to enjoy the art by participating in it. They learn to play the orchestra and study to dance under the guidance of those teachers mentioned above. Statue carving and painting have developed since the arrival of Hindu Religion. However they were dedicated for Religious purposes at first. At that time, R. Bonnet, a Swiss artist staying at Peliatan. R. Bonnet is always remembered for having introduced the artists of Peliatan to the World. At Peliatan, there was a kind of interest to combine the existed arts with the style introduced by R. Bonnet.

properties.name: Pemecutan Palace
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali This is one of some palaces opened to visitors located on Jalan Thamrin 2, Denpasar, one of the tourist-packages offered in Denpasar city-tour program. It is about 200 meters from Puputan Badung Park to the West and close to the two traditional markets: Pasar Badung and Pasar Kumbasari. The traditional Balinese-architectured palace was built around 17 th century and nowadays managed by the last King of Denpasar : Ida Cokorda Pemecutan. The palace is also completed with accommodation for those who want to stay and enjoy the royal atmosphere.

properties.name: Penataran Sasih
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali This temple has become famous because of the big bronze drum of 186,5 cm high with diameter of 160 cm. This drum derived from pre-Hindu time and also known as "a moon" of Pejeng, believed as moon falling to the Earth. That is why this temple is called Penataran Sasih temple, ("sasih" means moon). The most interesting of this, is the decoration of "Pejeng Moon", in the form of mask set up in couples with its big overlooking eyes, its long ears with earrings made of Chinese coins with its triangle nose. Inside the temple, there are numbers of old and significant statues.

properties.name: Petilan Pengerebongan Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The temple is known for a very specific event called: Ngerebong", when a group of the temple\'s adherents carrying effigies, Barong and Rangda as sacred personifications of Deities, move in procession around the temple\'s hall. Most of them are in trance, stabbing them with "Kris", the sacred dagger. Other ritual called "Tabuh Rah" is held in the morning when two cocks involved in a duel till one of them falls dead and its blood shed to the ground. The rituals come in every 210 days. The temple is located at Kesiman Petilan traditional village belongs to East Denpasar District, about 5 km East of Denpasar. The temple can be easily reached by public-transport from any where.

properties.name: Ponjok Batu Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali As previously mentioned, Ponjok Batu Temple is closely related to the journey of Danghyang Nirartha or Danghyang Dwijendra to Bali and Lombok. In "Dwijendra Tatwa" manuscript it is told that at the time of Dalem Waturenggong, King of Gelgel\'s reign around 1411 Icaka Year or 1489 AD, the holy high priest arrived in Bali and stayed in Gelgel. One day, he visited the North coast of Bali, created a cape on the site where He was standing. The cape was fully covered by stone and wild bush and watching at the distance where the open sea extended, suddenly He saw a traditional canoe ("perahu") washed ashore. He then hurried to help and soon the "perahu-man" got conscious and extended their gratefulness for the magic help of the Holy priest. Since the sea was calm, it was the best time to sail according to Danghyang Nirartha, so they then set sail to Lombok. Soon, after the Holy High priest left the beach there were some miracles taking-place at that location. The stones, on which He stood on before, flamed up and some springs suddenly came up around the site, so that the locals then came in through to do mass prayer. Finally, a temple was then built on the site with the main shrine called "Sanggar Agung" and the whole temple functioned as "Kahyangan" temple with regional adherents.\' The temple was later called "Ponjok Batu Temple".

properties.name: Prosurf School
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Learn to surf with the top surf school in Bali - voted "Best Surf School in Bali" for 3 consecutive years by Magic Wave Surf Community Magazine. Pro Surf School offers comprehensive surfing lessons for beginners, intermediate and advanced surfers, as well as surf trips around Bali. Experience the fun and excitement of surfing! How it feels to brake away and slide down the face of a wave… with the support of a great bunch of friendly coaches.The surf school program is fun, structured, professional and safe. Great setting, atmosphere and smiling faces makes all the difference!!We’ll go as far as guaranteeing the best instructors and surf experience on the island. We are also located right at Half Way Kuta Beach, which has probably the best waves for learning in Kuta & Bali.Testimony to our success is our guest comments that speak volumes!! We hope to see you in Bali to experience the thrill and excitement of surfing some of the best waves in the world!Got any questions? See if we\'ve answered them already in our newly updated Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) page. (September 2008)

properties.name: Puputan Badung
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Denpasar City is known for being the focus of "Puputan", the total war against the Dutch colonialist taking - place in September 20 th, 1906, at the time when the people of Badung involved themselves in a very heroic struggle, a war till the last drop of their blood to defense their beloving country home. This heroic moment is always commemorated every September 20th and for that a Monument called "Puputan Badung" was built on the Northern side of the square shaded by some big trees framing it. Local people with family from every corner of the city regularly visit the park in the afternoon and on Sundays various programs for children are held to make the atmosphere more cheerful. Puputan square is also the site where some rituals are held like "Saraswati" Holiday to celebrate the descend of Holy Commands of Vedas, "Tawur Agung Kesanga", (Great Sacrificial Ceremony to welcome Nyepi, the Isaka New Year), and "Ogoh-ogoh" procession in the evening. The Puputan Badung Park is surrounded by Pura Agung Jagatnatha, Bali Museum, Jaya Sabha the Governor of Bali\'s residence and Udayana military headquarter.

properties.name: Pura Agung Jagatnatha
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The inhabitants of Singaraja are quite heterogenic. They have different belief or religion, however, Hindu followers are dominant. A part of the Hindu followers come from the other regencies of Bali who then permanently live in Singaraja due to their occupations or education. Those coming from outside Singaraja sometimes have to be absent to go home to attend ceremonies due to limited fund, time and some other reasons, so that condition then turned up the idea of Buleleng Regent at that time (Drs. I Ketut Ginantra) to build a temple in Singaraja as the central holy place for the entire Hindu followers in Buleleng regency in general or Singaraja town in particular to do their religious obligations. The corner-stone laying ceremony was held in April 9, 1990 and the main ceremony called "Ngenteg Linggih" was done in July 4, 1993.

properties.name: Pura Agung Pulaki
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  The temple, instead of being the holy place to worship Almighty God (Sang Hyang Widhi Wasa), is also the place to respect and worship the Holy spirit of "Cri Patni Keniten" one of Danghayang Nirartha\'s (one of holy High priest coming from Java) wives who is also often called : "Bathari Dalem Ktut", so the existence of the temple is closely related to Danghyang Nirartha\'s Journey to Bali. Pulaki Temple, as a matter of fact is a holy complex consisted of: Pura Agung Pulaki (the Grand Temple) with it\'s "relative" ("Pesanakan") temples i.e.: Melanting Temple, Kertha Kawat Temple, Pabean Temple and Pemuteran Temple. The distance of each temple to the others is about 1.5 km with the Grand Temple (Pura Agung Pulaki) as the central. When the time comes for the temple\'s anniversary celebration, the adherents coming from the most parts of the island will be focused at Pura Agung Pulaki (the Grand Temple) and it means that they also at once worship the Deities dwelling at the other temples. Melanting Temple as one of "Pesanakan" (relative) temples of Pura Agung Pulaki is now seen more glorious after the renovation. The temple, to where people mainly traders, entrepreneurs and those engaged in economic sector, come is believed to be the holy place in which the Goddess of Prosperity dwells. At Pemuteran Temple, one can find several hot springs mostly visited by tourists or the temple\'s adherents for purification ceremony. A public - bathing - place is located outside the temple.

properties.name: Pura Kebo Edan‎
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The local people call this place as Kebo Edan Statue (Mad Buffalo statue), as it is dancing on a dead body, wearing a mask and its sex organ is swaying around. Beside this statue, there are also several old remains like a demon statue with a skull as decoration, some of them have been broken and some other more are still complete.

properties.name: Pura Kehen
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The Pura Kehen (Temple of the Treasury), some 2.5 km (11/2 mi.) north of the town center, is one of the largest and finest temples on Bali. Built on seven terraces below the hill of Bukit Bangli, it was founded in the 11th century by the princely priest Sri Brahma Kemute Ketu. It contains valuable bronze tablets believed to date from 1204, the year in which Bangli was founded. The first four terraces lead up to a covered gate (candi korung) at the entrance to the main temple precinct. To the right of this, in the outer forecourt, is a bale for the gamelan orchestra; to the right another bale is now an assembly point for visitors to the temple. In the center of the outer forecourt stands the Batu Keramat, a stone ... More > which is venerated as sacred. On the far side of the forecourt steps lead up to the split gate (candi bentar) at the entrance to the inner forecourt, on the next terrace. Beyond the gate, to right and left, are two buildings in which shadow plays are performed during temple festivals. Set into the wall on the far side of the forecourt are pieces of faience of Chinese origin. Another split gate leads into the innermost and most sacred part of the temple, on the far side of which (the side nearest the hill) are a number of merus with varying numbers of tiers (the tallest, with eleven tiers, being dedicated to Shiva), shrines for various divinities and tugus (stone lanterns which are the abode of divinities of lower rank). From the innermost courtyard, on the highest of the seven terraces, there are good views of the whole temple precinct and of Mt Batur.

properties.name: Pura Luhur Uluwatu
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali

properties.name: Pura Meduwe Karang
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The most impressing temple of northern and central areas Balis, Pura Meduwe Karang, is in village Kubutambahan a little to the east Singaraja. It patronises the agricultural crops growing on the dry earths (cocoes, corn and a peanut). The temple rises effective terraces with well-groomed territory in an environment of an almond grove. Island Bali. The island north. At forward steps there are 34 figures from Ramayana, and the central court yard is decorated by a carving on themes of folklore of inhabitants of Bali. In an internal court yard one of the most known carved panels hides: the bicyclist in colour shorts and a rat, ready to rush under a back wheel, being rescued from a dog pursuing her. These live pictures are surprisingly human, and after all this quality does not suffice a carving of other temples of Bali.

properties.name: Pura Ulun Danu Beratan
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Pura Ulun Danu Bratan, or Pura Bratan, is a major water temple on Bali, Indonesia — the other major water temple being Pura Ulun Danu Batur. The temple complex is located on the shores of Danau Bratan (Lake Bratan) in the mountains near Bedugul. Water temples serve the entire region in the outflow area; downstream there are many smaller water temples that are specific to each irrigation association (subak).

properties.name: Puri Lukisan Ratna Warta Museum
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The history of tourism in Gianyar was started at the early of 20th century at the time of the reign of the king of Ubud; i.e. Tjokorda Agung Sukawati, initiated with a few foreigners stayed in the palace of Ubud, among others are German artist named Walter Spies, musical artist; Collin MC Phee, an anthropologist, Miguel Covarrubias a Spanish writer. In 1935 Tjokorda Agung Sukawati, Walter Spies and R. Bonnet built an artist union deriving its members from several regions in Bali. This union was called \'Pita Mafia\' and in order preserve the arts products, they them built \'Ratna Warta Museum\' Puri Lukisan Ubud. The high qualities of art product of the people are displayed there.

properties.name: Pusering Jagat Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The most important oldness of this place is "Bejana" (bowl) made of stone, describing the Gods in search of holy water. This Bejana dated back in 1329 B.C. indicating Majapahit Kingdom era in East Java. In 1952 parts of the Bejana were broken and it had recently been reconstructed. This "Bejana" is also called "Sangku Sudarnala" (Purification bowl). Besides, there is also a "Purus House" in which a phallus and female sex organ statues are kept and made as natural as possible. ("Purus" means male sex organ).

properties.name: Q Bar
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Caucasian owned, and very popular either among local gays or international gays. Sometimes it has drag queen show also. Be there after 11.30 pm unless you want to see how\'s Q bar when empty.

properties.name: Queens Tandoor
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali For more than 18 years “QUEEN"S” restaurant has been serving Indonesia with the finest array of dishes and gourmet masterpiece coupled with its renowed service. Enjoyed by millions "QUEEN\'S TANDOOR" decided to open a branch in Bali on 23rd December 2004. Located in prime area at Seminyak, a special restaurant where everyone can enjoy and thrill those unaccustomed to fine Indian dining. Little India (Queen"s) in Bali was opened with hard efforts to contribute to land of Bali. Mr. Puneet Malhotra, who is holding 3 Year Degree in Hotel Management from India & his expertise experience with Giant group like Hyatt International & Le-Meridien Hotel, he developed his own business strategies and brought Authentic Indian cuisine in Bali with his wife Neeta Shamdasani who studied abroad in London. They with their professional efforts, dedication, innovations and hard work made this place one of the most favorite, clean Indian Place for Indian Cuisine Lover in Bali. Jalan Raya Seminyak No 73 (Gallery Seminyak). Kuta Bali - Indonesia. Phone : 62 - 361 - 732770. Fax : 62 - 361 - 732771. email : bali@queenstandoor.com

properties.name: Raja's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Whatever your intentions are - from enjoying the deliciously selected menus with various tastes, quench your thirst with a variety of choices for drinks, meeting an old friend to having a birthday party, lunch meeting, dinner gathering and hang out with your buddies to watch a show in the big screen - RAJA\'S is the place for you.

properties.name: Reef Seen Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali "Selamat Datang" - Welcome to Reef Seen Aquatics... Home of ‘Reef Seen Turtle Hatchery’, ‘Reef Seen Dancers’ & the ‘Reef Gardeners of Pemuteran” Does diving and snorkeling appeal to you? Or perhaps taking a holiday in a peaceful, hassle free environment, with colourful, coral reefs and fishlife commencing just 20metres from the beach? If yes is your answer then you are ready for North-West Bali & Reef Seen Aquatics Dive Centre. World-class diving and incredible snorkeling apart, we offer calm beaches, loads of sunshine, fascinating culture, pony rides for the children, all to be found here in the Village of Pemuteran, North-West Bali, and not a hawker in sight. Our choice of Pemuteran was dictated not just by its virgin locales but also by its friendly people. The villagers of Pemuteran are wonderful people both friendly and caring. As the founder of Reef Seen and dive tourism in the area, I have been working with the local community in an effort to enhance their lives through Eco-Friendly practices and education.

properties.name: SOS Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali International SOS is a medically driven and professionally managed company. By combining our vast experiences and global expertise, we create custom solutions that help clients cost-effectively manage the medical risks of operating and traveling across the world. Our emergency assistance services, medical services, managed health care solutions and Security Overseas Services (SOS Security) are globally recognized for the reliability, quality, people and expertise. We take pride in the fact that we save lives and provide valued services to those in need.

properties.name: Sakenan Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  The temple was built in 11th century by the holy high priest Danghyang Dwijendra" (based on "Usana Dewa" manuscript) on Serangan Island. To reach the temple one can go on boat through the mangrove forest for about 20 minutes or just drive directly through the bridge and park the car at the parking-lot within the temple area. There are three main temples on the island i.e.: Pura Sakenan, Pura Susunan Wadon and Pura Dalem Cemara. The temples will be overcrowded during the anniversary: celebration called "Odalan" when people as the temple\'s adherents as well as visitors gathered there to attend the ceremony and to watch traditional entertainments. From this island one can enjoy the beauty of the narrow straits of Tanjung Benoa and Nusa Penida Island belonging to Klungkung regency, in the distance.

properties.name: Sangeh
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali In the seventeenth century during the golden time of the Kingdom of Mengwi, the King of Mengwi, I Gusti Agung Ketut Karangasem, son of I Gusti Agung Made Agung built a temple in the middle of a nutmeg forest, later called : Bukit Sari Temple. The nutmeg forest is a holy area very much respected by the local people of Sangeh traditional village and the villages nearby, so that it is considered sacred, meanwhile it then develops into a place of interest attracting multi national visitors with hundreds of tame monkey in habitants inside the evergreen tropical forest.

properties.name: Sanur Beach
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Sanur beach is located at Sanur Village, Denpasar district. Denpasar municipality main beach is in the eastern and southern of Sanur village. It is has been wellknown since a long time ago, especially when a war called " Puputan Badung" took place on 20 September 1906, and when the Dutch anchored his troops there. In the history of old Bali, Sanur Beach is also very famous, since it was found a written stone of the King of Kesari Warmadewa that resided at Singhadwala in 917 at Blanjong South of Sanur Beach. This beach was first in troduced by a Belgian painters A.T. Le Mayeur with his Balinese wife Ni Polok who had stayed there since 1937 and often held painting exhibitions of his own. The main atraction of Sanur Beach is the one at Northern Part which has a half circle and the Southern part has a turning point from the east to the west, with not so big wave. In a low tide one can see coral reefs stretching colourfully. When it is approaching dead moon, it has a high tide. In the south east, one can see Nusa Penida island across the sea and in the eastern, the panorama of south beach of Bali island along with its range of mountains is a spectacular sight that should not be missed. In the afternoon the scenary of the beach is very beautiful.

properties.name: Satria Palace
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The palace that rebuilt in 1930 is also one of the palaces set up as one of points of interest of Denpasar city-tour program. It is located on Jalan Veteran, right at the heart of Denpasar, inside of which the royal-family temple, "Pemerajan Puri Agung Satria" is located, where some traditional entertainments are often on stage, especially during the temple\'s anniversary celebration (every 210 days according to the Balinese calendar), or often held on request by some tour-operators. In front of the temple one can find the Bird market (Pasar Burung) which is also another attraction for visitors and the locals mainly those of animal-lovers. Satria Palace has a very specific architecture, a kind of building-design called "Pendopo" in which a meeting of the Kings of Bali was held in the past. Satria Palace is not far from the other places of interest previously mentioned like: Bali Museum, Jagatnatha Temple and Puputan Badung Park.

properties.name: Sebatu and Pujung Village
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali According to the chronicle of "Bhuwana Tatwa Maha Resi Markandeya" which narrated the visit of the Highpriest (Maha Resi) Markandeya to Bali in 18th century. He built a temple in Tohlangkir, further he went to the west and built Sarwada Village which is now well known as Taro village. He also built a temple, known as \'Gunung Raung Temple\'. Facing the facts that Sebatu village is in the east boundary with Taro village, and then the journey of this Highpriest from Gunung Agung continued to Taro village via Sebatu village. The name of Sebatu is connected with a story in "Usada Bali" manuscript i.e. Mayadenawa story. At the time of war between Mayadenawa and God Indra, Mayadenawa was defeated. He ran away, and in his escape he tried to avoid his enemies troops by transforming himself into many kinds of things using his magical powers. However his efforts were always in vain and when he arrived at one place, because of his fatique, he slipped on a stone, so then this place was called "Sauhbatu" ("Sauk" means slip, "batu" means stone). In its development, it becomes Sebatu as a result of modification process.

properties.name: Semarapura Museum
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali One can find the museum on the west part of Kertha Gosa/ Taman Gili complex, a building with unique architecture Dutch style in combination with the Balinese traditional architecture. During the Dutch occupation, the building was used to be the building of MULO (High School) and then became the building of "SMP Negeri (Public Secondary School) of Klungkung up to the end of 1990 and after having some renovations, the building with its specific charm then transformed into a museum called "Semarapura Museum" as one of tourist attractions available in Klungkung regency.

properties.name: Shinkei Spa
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Skinkei Spa offers a wide range of relaxing massages and body treatments after a long day of Kuta-shopping or surfing at the nearby world-famous beach of Pantai Kuta. You are more then welcome to contact us at any time with your questions and suggestions to further improve our service packages.

properties.name: Sibetan Village
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali As one of tourist destination in Karangasem, Sibetan village offers natural panorama (agro tourism). Sibetan village is 400-600 m above the sea level, with the average temperature of 20º-30º C. Its average rainfall is 1.567 mm - 20.000 mm per year. The cool climate and the comforting air make salak or skin snake fruit grows well in this area. Here, visitors can find various vegetations of salak with different tastes. The vast salak garden in this village is also interesting to see. Almost 81,12% of Sibetan\'s area, which is 1.125.000 hectares, is turned into salak garden. Thus, about 14 various vegetations of salak can be found here, in which it cannot be seen in other areas. Mostly, visitors come to Sibetan village to witness directly the complete cultivation process of salak, including its marketing process. Except showing the vast salak garden, Sibetan is also worth to visit for its unique and special culture and traditional art performances, such as dances and "genjek" and the show of traditional music instrument called "angklung". To enjoy the natural view of this area, visitors can join the trekking activity that will be led by local guides.

properties.name: Silq Kerobokan Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali SILQ Kerobokan, new luxury resort villas ideally situated amid tranquil verdant rice fields. Guests can expect exemplary personal service in a luxuriously intimate environment. Indulge your senses and come savor a truly authentic experience based on the Balinese traditions and rituals. Built simply on elemental layers that are both natural and crafted, SILQ rests on the foundation of exclusivity and pure comfort. SILQ nourishes this harmonious replenishment with spectacular surroundings and the good wealth of cool clear waters in fields of grain.

properties.name: Sing-sing Waterfall
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali During dry season, the water volume of the waterfall will drop relatively, however it will always be pleasant to be there and enjoy the breeze. The ascending road to the site can be an interesting point for those who are fond of "trekking" activity and due to its short distance from Lovina tourist resort and can be reached on foot, this place has often been visited by tourists mostly stay at Lovina Beach. It is not far from the waterfall, there is a monument known as "the Dutch Monument", built by the Dutch colonial government to respect one of their military officer who died in the battle of Banjar in 1868. Around 1956 the monument was destroyed by the local patriots, however it was then rebuilt by the local government of Buleleng regency in 1992 With consideration that a history will not be possible to wiped off and moreover the monument can also symbolize the heroism of Banjar people so that they were able to kill a Dutch military officer.

properties.name: Singa Ambara Raja Monument
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali This monument was built on a five-angled base symbolizing the National five Principles, "Pancasila". The pole supporting "Singa Ambara Raja" statue is in the form of nine lotus-petals symbolizes Buleleng regency consisted of 9 districts. A pair of wings of the lion, each consists of 17 long feathers, while one of the lion\'s front legs holding "gimbal" maize consists of 8 leaves and 45 grains, all of which means the date of the Indonesian Independent day : 17 August 1945. Long and short feathers of the two wings in total are: 30, symbolizing the birthday of Singaraja, grown on three pieces of bones symbolizing the month, while fine fur covering the entire body of the lion is in total of 1604 indicating the year. So, the entire body of "Singa Ambara Raja" statue symbolizes the birthday of Singaraja i.e. : 30 March 1604 while the monument was officially functioned in March 30,1971.

properties.name: Singaraja
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Singaraja is the regency seat of Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia. The name is Indonesian for \'Lion King\'. It is on the north coast just east of Lovina. It has an area of 27.98 km² and population of 80,500. Singaraja was the Dutch colonial administrative centre for Bali and the Lesser Sunda Islands until 1953, and the port of arrival for most visitors until development of the Bukit Peninsula area in the south. Gedong Kirtya, just south of the town centre, is the only library of lontar manuscripts (ancient and sacred texts on leaves of the rontal palm) in the world.

properties.name: Soka Beach
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Up to this time, Soka Beach\'s history is still unknown. One definitive thing is Soka Beach has long been a stopover for people going to / from Java instead of the story about the mighty Kebo Iwa as previously mentioned. Luhur Serijong Temple is a temple adhered by Hindu followers of Tabanan regency as well as from the other parts of Bali, mostly by "Subak" members (traditional irrigation/farming organization) since the temple is believed to be the place where people worship the Lord of food stuff (Dewi Sri/Goddess of Rice).

properties.name: Spa Factory Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali As a creator and supplier of treatment & retail products to many of Bali\'s and leading spas worldwide, we have now opened our doors to the public. A free guided tour covers every aspect of the production of unique spa treatment products. Visitors can see how massage oil is blended, scrubs & body masks ground to delicate powders and exotic minerals composed into bath salts. We even have a soap room where our process for making all natural vegetable soap is revealed.

properties.name: Studio Perak
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Studio Perak\'s main philosophy, whether in design and production of their unique silver jewelry pieces, or in the teaching of their students, is simplicity.
