We strive to make beautiful, wearable and comfortable jewelry using the most basic hand tools. Our methodology of silver smithing differs little from that of Balinese silversmiths 100 or more years ago. By keeping things simple, we strive to preserve a little piece of Balinese culture through our work. By learning with this methodology in our classes, our students are able to continue exploring silver making well after their experience with us, by purchasing only a few hand tools.

properties.name: Sukawati Art Market
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Sukawati Art Market is located on Jl. Raya Sukawati, Gianyar, across the Sukawati Traditional Market. Set in a new two-story building, the art market sells a wide variety of merchandises, ranging from statues to dance costumes, all at reasonable prices. A large variety of woven baskets can be found here along with Balinese ceremonial items made from colorful prada (gold painted cloth). Spending a nice holiday on the island of Paradise is full of endless experience. This tiny island has so many treasures and challenging adventure to explore. See the unique rice terraces in Tegalalang or Jatiluwih with its serenity and beauty on the rice fields. Or follow and inhale fresh air along the rapid on the river with a wide choice of different rapid. Another activity you will enjoy is an original "shopping adventure" to hunt souvenirs and the like in the art market.

properties.name: Suluban Beach
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  Suluban Beach is one of the places of interest belonging to Badung regency. It is known for its beautiful beach, best for surfing and other recreational activities. The natural beauty of the southern tip of Bali highland with its crystal-like waves and the peaceful surroundings has attracted more and more visitors to enjoy its serenity and peacefulness.

properties.name: Taman Ayun Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Built in the 1600s, the temple of Taman Ayun is nestled in 3 different levels and is bordered by a river. The inner courtyard itself has a moat of water that separates it from the exterior gardens. Around the temple are pavilions and canopied shades that invite the visitors to relax in leisure.

properties.name: Taman Sari Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali As previously mentioned, Taman Sari Temple is located on the North-east of Semarapura or about 500 meters from the town-centre. The beauty of this temple is seen from the emerging of the eleven and nine storey roofed shrines (merus) from the pond. Eleven storey-roofed shrine for the Hindus, symbolizing Mount Mahameru standing on a giant turtle, drowned in milky ocean. Then, came the Deities and demons to stir the mountain with Anantaboga dragon to be the rope winder. From the process of stirring the milky ocean then came up "Amerta" holy water (water of life). The mythology depicted from Adi Parwa epic in which described the great power of the "Tirta Amertha" as the water of life for the world and human beings. Taman Sari Temple is also known as the holy place to keep and honor all the heirlooms from Majapahit Kingdom time belonging to Kepakisan Dynasty as the ruler of Bali. Even though all the heirlooms had been robbed by the Dutch colonialist during "Puputan Klungkung" war in 1908, the ornament of "Padma Anglayang" (flying lotus) as the coat¬of-arms of Majapahit Kingdom can still be found there. The temple was built by the end of XVII century at the time when the descendant of Kepakisan dynasty moved from Gelgel village to Klungkung and considered to be the top ruler of Bali. The most significant thing noted from Taman Sari Temple is this was the place when Ida I Dewa Aging Istri Kania, the heroin of Klungkung gave an order to counter the attack of the Dutch troops at Kusamba village in 1849. She made Taman Sari Temple as the head-quarter of Klungkung troops and ordered the using of the sacred heirloom named"I Seliksik" to her troops. This mission was very successful in destroying the Dutch troops on Kusamba beach and their great loss was the death of General Michiels in that war. Since the renovation done in 1979 the temple and surroundings has been back to its original condition.

properties.name: Tampaksiring Palace and Tirta Empul Temple
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Tampaksiring Palace is one of the Republic of Indonesia\'s Presidential Palaces located on this island. The Palace was built upon the idea of the late President Soekarno, the first President of the Republic of Indonesia in 1957, the site on which was formally built the resting house of the King of Gianyar and had been known as a place of interest since long time ago. The palace is located on highland with beautiful designed sets of building, spacious courtyard decorated with flower gardens and shady big trees surrounding it. The weather is cool and pleasant and the palace is marvelously overlooking Tirta Empul Temple with its lovely natural pools and bathing-places, freshly watered with natural spring inside the temple. On the front yard of the temple there are row of souvenir-strops with interesting displays of various styles of handicrafts made of wood, bone, coconut, shell, etc. According to the folks tale told among the locals, the name "Tampaksiring "derived from the story of "Maya Denawa" when a battle took place between Maya Denawa\'s troops against Bethara Indra\'s. Maya Denawa ran away from the battle with slanting foot palms for which he then finally defeated (slant = miring, foot palm = tapak, Tapak miring then became Tampaksiring).

properties.name: Tanah Lot
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Tanah Lot means "Land in the Middle of the sea" in Balinese language. Located in Tabanan, about 20 km from Denpasar, the temple sits on a large offshore rock which has been shaped continuously over the years by the ocean tide. Tanah Lot is claimed to be the work of the 15th century priest Nirartha. During his travels along the south coast he saw the rock-island\'s beautiful setting and rested there. Some fishermen saw him, and bought him gifts. Nirartha then spent the night on the little island. Later he spoke to the fishermen and told them to build a shrine on the rock for he felt it to be a holy place to worship the Balinese sea gods. The Tanah Lot temple was built and has been a part of Balinese mythology for centuries. The temple is one of seven sea temples around the Balinese coast. Each of the sea temples were established within eyesight of the next to form a chain along the south-western coast. At the base of the rocky island, poisonous sea snakes are believed to guard the temple from evil spirits and intruders. As well as one giant snake which also protects the temple, which was created from Nirartha’s scarf when he established the island.

properties.name: Tegallinggah Cliff Monument
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The building found by a Dutch archeologist, Mr. Krijgsman is only known by the local people in the form of an entrance gate leading into a cave covered by the soil. When it was digged, there was a stair found to go upward. On the right part, there is a bigger one; however it has been in ruins. At the back of the building there is a yard in which two gates carved on its wall. On the left of the gate is an unfinished temple with roof roughly carved on the rock.

properties.name: Teluk Gilimanuk
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Gilimanuk can be said as the Western gate of Bali and it is the transit port between Java and Bali. Gilimanuk is a beautiful place with calm and clear water, best for sailing and water skiing.

properties.name: Tenganan Pegringsingan Village
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Tenganan is an ancient village located at the district of Manggis belongs to Karangasem regency. It is ideally located between two range of highland on the West and East sides while on the North lies dry land and rice field and on the South is a small village named Pesedahan. It is about 66 km is distance from Denpasar to the North-East or about 15 km West of Amlapura, the capital town. The ancient village is mentioned in "Ujung Inscription" from the eleventh century, in wick mentioned that the village formerly named "Paneges". Referring to the folk tale, the people of Tenganan originally came from coastal area close to Candi Dasa beach, a village with similar name, Paneges, supposed to be derived from the word “Teges” the name of village near Bedulu at Gianyar regency believe to be their village of origin. Gradually, they moved towards hinterland up to the locations where they then settled until present time, Tenganan Pegringsingan.

properties.name: Terazo Restaurant and Bar
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Located in Ubud on quiet Suweta Street, just a stone"s throw from the center of town, TeraZo restaurant and bar is a must-visit while in town. Designed in a colonial modern style by international design firm Hananto Lloyd, Terazo features banquette dining, a stylish lounge and mahogany bar downstairs. Casual glam awaits you in the dining room upstairs! Open for lunch and dinner, Terazo offers exquisite food and wine from across the globe. Enjoy the open-air ambience while we prepare pan-Asian and international dishes from the freshest local and imported ingredients. Our aquarium on premises, and fish of the day specials, ensure your seafood is the freshest in town.

properties.name: The Art Centre
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali It is located on Nusa Indah Street, about 2 km in distance from the City Centre or Puputan Badung Park. The Art Centre was officially opened in February 14th, 1973. The Art Centre is a building - complex with Balinese traditional architecture with an extent of about 5 hectares consisted of: • Exhibition Hall called Mahudara Mandhara Giri Bhuana where paintings and other traditional Balinese objects are exhibited. The Hall is located on the north side of the Art Centre Complex. • The Ksirarnawa Hall, a two-storey hall in which various kinds of performing arts are on stage on the upper floor white exhibitions of handicrafts, gold and silverworks are held on the first floor. • The Ardha Candra open stage is located on the Eastern side, on which traditional performing-arts, music-concerts and fashion-shows are often held, • Other building is the Wantilan, Hall for similar purpose. The Art Centre opens everyday from 07.00 a.m - 02.00 p.m (except holidays).

properties.name: The Bale
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The Balé is a rare gem, a retreat dedicated to revitalizing your soul. With just 29 blissful pavilions, each with their own private swimming pool and modern, fashionable interiors, The Balé offers you the chance to relax and revitalize in style. Stroll through peaceful white − walled courtyards and past refreshing water pools, indulge in the unique collection of holistic spa treatments and well-being programs and dine on the freshest organic produce. Enjoy the friendliest and most refined service − what we call out "hospitality from the heart". Come and experience its magic.

properties.name: The Neka Art Museum
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The Neka Art Museum was opened in 1982 and is named after a Balinese teacher Suteja Neka who collected paintings as a means of artistic documentation. Nowadays the museum has a great selection of works from many famous Balinese artists and expats who have lived here and influenced local artists.

properties.name: Tihingan Village
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali This village is known in Bali as the centre of "Gamelan"/ Gong and other sets of traditional music-instruments like: Semara Pegulingan, Gender Wayang (music-instrument to accompany shadow puppet performance), "angklung" (special music instrument to accompany human life cycle ceremonies) and so on made of "kerawang" metal (metal with special process). This special skill has long been inherited from their ancestors known as "Pande Gong from Tihingan Village". Balinese Gamelan produced by Tihingan village has been known in Indonesia or even overseas for its special tone and appearance; so no wonder if one sometime find some foreigners visiting Tihingan to study more about Gamelan or to order one set of it to take it to their country.

properties.name: Tirta Gangga
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Tirta Gangga was built in 1921 by Anak Agung Gede Jelantik, King or Karangasem\'s heir. At the time of Mount Agung eruption in 1963, along with the big earth-quake took place, the water-garden was dominantly damaged, but restorations have been done since then up to the condition resulted at the present time.

properties.name: Tombes Royales de Gunung Kavi
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Besides XI century, as well as Goa Gajah, sanctuary Gunung Kavi concerns. Located on a fine panoramic place and every day visited by crowds of the tourists involved here not only charm of the surrounding nature, but also fine monuments, the sanctuary shows the direct certificate of ancient culture of Bali. Near to a sanctuary parking for cars is equipped and a number of the ladders facilitating rise of tourists to a temple is arranged. The sanctuary is directly connected with memory of tsar Anak Vungsu, the noble son of tsar Udajana Varmadeva and tsarina Mahendradatta which corrected in 1049-1077. Everything, that is known today about this sanctuary, is written in the text under name Haji lumah ing Jalu. Till now ritual ceremonies in sanctuary Gunung Kavi collect local population; people come to pray to gods and to bring, as the gratitude tribute, traditional gifts to the ancient tsar and his family

properties.name: Tony Raka Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali TONYRAKA ART GALLERY established in 1968 by A.A Gede Raka Wirayuda (before the name was Raka Gallery), formerly known as a remarkable carver. For nearly 30 years the gallery has been accumulating and selling its collection, which mostly are fine wood carving artwork. In 1997, the business continued by his son, A.A Bagus Tony Hartawan, who finally broaden the item range of the gallery. The gallery starts to present antiques and paintings. The antique collection comes mostly from local area, Bali and Java; and the paintings are the artwork of young, potential Balinese artists, as well as of other well-known painters.

properties.name: Tulamben Village
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Tulamben village grows into tourist area for its strategic position and because of the beauty of its surroundings. From here, we will be able to witness the fascinating view of Mount Agung on the west side. Besides, it also offers a magnificent panorama of marine life. In our underwater adventure, we will find the wreck of US Liberty ship from the World War II. It becomes another attraction of Tulamben for visitors. While going back to the past, in this sunken ship, we will see beautiful tropical fish and other marine lives.

properties.name: Ubud Hanging Gardens
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Ubud Hanging Gardens Hotel & Resort, Bali, Indonesia is a haven of peace and tranquillity set in the heart of the tropical paradise of Bali. The resort has 38 luxury private pool villas, each with a heated private infinity plunge pool set high in the rice terraces overlooking the Ayung river.

properties.name: Uluwatu Handmade Balinese Lace
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Uluwatu - Handmade Balinese Lace presents something very special from the the island of Bali.In this lush green paradise that has been called "the Morning of the World", that the Balinese themselves call "the Island of the Gods", it seems there is nothing that cannot become a canvas for an artist\'s imagination.Because in Bali artistic ability is not regarded as a rare talent. Children learn their skills sitting at their parents\' knee, absorbing the techniques while watching painters as they paint, listening to musicians as they play. Artistic expression becomes part of life.For over 20 years Uluwatu has drawn upon these natural skills to produce lace of a unique quality.This lace work, known in English as cutwork, is called krawang in Balinese. Uluwatu krawang is made in the traditional way: Lace is stretched on bamboo hoops and sewn by hand on foot-powered machines identical to the old Singer machines now seen only as antiques in the rest of the world. Jl. Danau Tondano No.59 Sanur 80228 Bali Indonesia Telephone: +62361287638 Facsimile: +62 361 287 054 Corporate Email : info@uluwatu.co.id

properties.name: Uma Sapna
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Experience privacy and luxury, “just the way you like it” at the newly completed Uma Sapna boutique villas in Bali. The resort is situated in a residential environment in the heart of Bali’s upscale Seminyak village. Featuring twenty one and two bedroom villas, scattered over the property, each protected for privacy. Shopping and international dining are within five minutes walking distance. Uma Sapna boasts all the expected comforts and services you will find in a five-star resort. Private dining can be enjoyed in your own villa. The Uma Sapna Spa offers a luxurious full-service massage and body therapy in any of our three spa treatment rooms or in the privacy of your villa.

properties.name: Vivalavi Bali Villas & Spa
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Vivalavi Bali - You are invited to have breakfast each morning either in the privacy of your villa or in the Vivalavi Villas restaurant which overlooks the swimming pool, games room, putting green, golf driving range, petanque, and lounge pavilions.

properties.name: Waroeng Bonita
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Choose a romantic dinner in the breezy garden, amid a candlelit grove of fragrant frangipani trees; or try our Indonesian buffet lunch, which has attracted a loyal following among local residents. A colorful mix of Indonesian professionals and expat artists flock to Waroeng Bonita for the all-day special: a plate heaped with hearty Indonesian food, your choice, and a fresh juice.

properties.name: Water Bom Bali
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali Get wet, get wowed! This is a sprawling 3.8-hectare tropical adventure park of exhilarating world-class water rides! High-speed slides, dizzying trails, cardiac-pounding rides. For the faint-hearted, relax! There’s a whole lot more for everyone in the family!

properties.name: Wave Kuta
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali The Wave, located on the famous Kuta Beach in Bali – the Island of Gods – is an entertainment and leisure hub that houses The Wave Club (a long bar and a discotheque), SailFin (Kuta\'s premier dining restaurant) and a beachfront shopping arcade. The Wave is where everyone can wash their worries away or simply escape from life\'s monotony. Fun, romance and awe-inspiring sunsets are some of the experiences we offer at The Wave and SailFin along with an array of gastronomic seafood delights, happening events and live music. Partnered with striking architecture and interior, The Wave is a place not to be missed (and where we\'re located, it\'s not easy to miss) when you decide on having an island holiday. The Wave is the latest centre of high-tech entertainment on Kuta\'s shores. A place of endless entertainment and leisure from basking under clear, sunny skies on our Deck to savouring mouth-watering meals with a magical view of Kuta\'s beach and renowned sunsets to drinking and dancing the night away to bass bumping beats. Jalan Pantai Kuta No.1 Kuta, Denpasar 80361 Bali - Indonesia Tel : +62.361.760.068 Fax : +62.361.750.948 Email : admin@wave-kuta.com

properties.name: Well Being Spa
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali AT NT Well being Spa we endeavor to combine traditional Indonesian beauty treatments with modern techniques and equipment, to ensure that your journey with us will be thoroughly peaceful, revitalizing and luxurious one. If you’ve come to Bali to relax, de stress or just to have fun, allow yourself to receive the utmost from holiday. From among our selection of aromatic herbs, essential oils, floral baths and relaxing massages, you can allow yourself to be pampered in just the way that you deserve. As environment plays such an important role in wellbeing, our spa has been specially designed and friendly, caring and highly trained staff will set you at ease, so that you can totally enjoy this special experience. The owner himself, Mr. Nata, a kind Balinese man, has tremendous 22 years of experiences in this field. He also had a chance to taste an International Level of Knowledge since he had his education in Australia. And to make a good use of this precious knowledge, he had devoted his service in Germany, Asia and a well known five star hotel in the world. Based on that, he always keeps his commitment on holding the hygiene standard in each and every spa he owned. On the same time, he taught his staffs to maintain the professional services with international standard which have been well known for years That’s why he could spread his wing, owning not only one place of service, but 3 places after 11 years. They are spread from seminyak to petitenget. You are welcome to visit and try any of those spots. For details of locations and how to get there, you can check our maps. But his foot steps have not stopped there. Starting a year ago, he is giving away his knowledge through Spa Academy. Based on his vision to provide the world with more professional spa therapists, he and some friends started this noble mission. If you are willing to taste the sweet knowledge, then you are welcome to join our academy. Jl. Laksmana No. 66b, Seminyak - Kuta - Bali Ph.: +62-361-735573; Fax. : +62-361-736112 Email : wellbeingspa@hotmail.com

properties.name: West Bali National Park
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali West Bali National Park in Indonesian as Taman Nasional Bali Barat is located on the north western side of Bali, Indonesia. The park covers around 770 square kilometres (300 sq mi), which is approximately 10% of Bali\'s total land area. To the north, it includes a 1,000-metre (3,300 ft) long beach, reef and islets. A seaport at Gilimanuk is west of the park, and the village of Goris is to the east. The National Park can be reached by roads from Gilimanuk and Singaraja, or by using ferries from Ketapang, Java. There are several habitats in the National Park, a savanna, mangroves, montane and mixed-monsoon forests, and coral islands. The center of the park is dominated by remnants of four volcanic mountains from Pleistocene era, with gunung Patas at 1,412 metres (4,630 ft) its highest elevation. Some 160 species can be found inside the park, including the Banteng, Barn Swallow, Black-naped Oriole, Black Racket-tailed Treepie, Crested Serpent-eagle, Crested Treeswift, Dollarbird, Hawksbill Turtle, Indian Muntjac, Java Sparrow, Javan Lutung, Large Flying Fox, Leopard Cat, Lesser Adjutant, Long-tailed Shrike, Milky Stork, Pacific Swallow, Red-rumped Swallow, Rusa Deer, Sacred Kingfisher, Savanna Nightjar, Stork-billed Kingfisher, Water Monitor, Wild Boar, Yellow-vented Bulbul and the critically endangered Bali Starling. There are also several endangered flora species in this national park, such as: Pterospermum diversifolium, Antidesma bunius, Lagerstroemia speciosa, Steleochocarpus burahol, Santalum album, Aleuritas moluccana, Sterculia foetida, Schleichera oleosa, Dipterocarpus hasseltii, Garcinia dulcis, Alstonia scholaris, Manilkara kauki, Dalbergia latifolia and Cassia fistula.

properties.name: Yeh Panes
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  According to the history, there was a Kingdom named "Penulisan" with the King named Jaya Wikrama who was suffering from a serious skin disease. Upon the suggestion of the minister Satya Wacana the King was then taken to a traditional healer named Ki Dukuh Tangkas at a village of Lampah at the northern part of Rajeg Uru forest (now known as "Jegu" village) by Ho River. On the way to Lampah Village, the King was tempted by a monkey at Rajeg Uru forest later known as beloved pet of the traditional healer, Ki Dukuh Tangkas. When Ki Dukuh Tangkas knew the purpose of the King\'s visit, he then taught the King a healing teaching called: "Usadha Bhakti" through a meditation system. One day, when the King and Ki Dukuh Tangkas practiced the teaching by doing meditation, by God\'s Blessing a hot spring out-poured from the ground. Ki Dukuh asked the King to take bath every "Kajeng Kliwon" (a Balinese point of time) until the King completely recovered. To express his gratefulness, the King then built a temple on that location called: "We Brahma" or "Toya Anget" Temple.

properties.name: Yeh pulu
properties.description: Posted by Isinbali  Yeh Pulu relief is carved on the rocky soil wall framing the rice field by Petanu River and the valley. The wall with the relief is about 25 meters long and 2 meters height with a hermitage cave located at the South end. Between the wall with the relief and the hermitage cave, there is a Ganesya (Deity with elephant head) statue. Regarding the carving style and ornament, Stutterheim stated that the relief carved in 14th and 15th centuries at the golden time and the initial time of declining the Majapahit Kingdom.
